{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient has secondary amenorrhea following a spontaneous abortion. This could be due to several reasons. Ovarian failure is unlikely as the FSH level is normal. Pituitary failure would also lead to abnormal FSH levels. Ongoing pregnancy would not result in amenorrhea. Uterine synechiae, also known as Asherman's syndrome, is a condition where scar tissue forms in the uterus, often after a surgical procedure such as a D&C following a miscarriage. This could prevent the normal menstrual cycle from occurring.", "answer_choice": "D. Uterine synechiae"}
